frameDefinitions: A Whole, an entity with a substructure, is assessed for whether or not it has all the necessary parts that are defined for it or for an entity of its kind.
An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.
This frame pertains to noise verbs used to characterize motion.
This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
A Cognizer thinks that the Information given by a particular Source is correct.
frameExamples: What happens after the PPB investigation is <t>complete</t>?
Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity that is being assessed for having all its necessary parts or not.
The interval of time when the completeness of the entity is assessed.
The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>:
This role describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place.
This role describes where the verificiation event takes place.

The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location.  In sentences containing a <fen>Cause</fen>, the <fen>Theme</fen> is typically the NP Object.  In other sentences, the <fen>Theme</fen> is normally the External Argument.
The <fen>Source</fen> is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of Motion.
The <fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is any expression which tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up as a result of the Motion.
This role identifies the general <fen>Area</fen> in which motion takes place, used particularly if the motion is understood as following a complex or non-linear path.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the motion event takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location of a more specific motion (which has <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, <fen>Goal</fen>, or <fen>Area</fen>).

The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who has an opinion about the reliability of a <fen>Information_source</fen> or the <fen>Information</fen> from the <fen>Information_source</fen>.
An object or action associated with the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which is so affected by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s belief that it reveals the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s state.
The individual that gives Information to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The text or speech which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has heard and evaluates the truth of.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Our list of participants</fex> is still incomplete.
My journey to the dark side is <fex>now</fex> complete.
<fex>His</fex> later verification of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.
It is extremely difficult to confirm <fex>the absence of something</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> confirms the reader 's suspicions completely.
<fex>Pat</fex> crunched over the fresh snow.
The train rumbled <fex>out of the station</fex>.
The truck roared <fex>through the tunnel</fex>.
The plates clattered <fex>to the floor</fex>.
The fly buzzed <fex>about the room</fex>.
The train screeched into the station <fex>at half past seven</fex>
<fex>Evelyn</fex> was candid about the party.
Evelyn made some candid <fex>remarks</fex>.
Evelyn was candid <fex>about the party</fex>.
Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
Her trustworthy <fex>eyes</fex> revealed that I was in no danger.
Why should we believe <fex>him</fex> ?
America trusted <fex>his declaration</fex> , to their detriment .
